intro: Anthopterus oliganthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are often consumed by birds, which aid in seed dispersal. Its botanical features include a well-developed root system that attaches to the host tree for nutrient absorption. Anthopterus oliganthus is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
